subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Two members of the Jaguars — the rookie linebacker Justin Durant and the second-year offensive tackle Richard Collier — were arrested in separate incidents early yesterday, and neither made the team’s trip to New Orleans for today’s game against the Saints. Police officers in Jacksonville, Fla., arrested Collier for driving under the influence, and Durant was charged with resisting arrest without violence. Eight Jaguars players have been arrested since January 2006.
